Aerodrome. Bombs were also dropped on Nagara and Chanak.On the night of 27th-28th August Constantinople was again bombed by three long-distance machines, large fires being caused which were visible for 60 miles. Other machines, assisted by a Greek unit, bombed Nagara and Galata. causing damage to hangars and living quarters. One of our machines is missing.On 31st August the cruiser " Endymion " was torpedoed whilst at anchor inside the nets at Stavros. Five compartments of the port " blister " were flooded, but an even keel was restored by the flooding of the starboard " blister." Two men are missing. The attacking submarine was engaged by bombs and gunfire, and is believed to have been damaged.On 29th August H.M. No enemy ships have entered or left Rotterdam.FOREIGN NAVAL INTELLIGENCE. France.Rear-Admiral Merveillaux du Vigneaux, C.B., lately commanding the Salonika Division, has been appointed Chief of Staff to the French Commander-in-Chief in the Mediterranean.Spain.Germany has not yet shown any intention of giving way to Spain on the question of the immunity of Spanish shipping in the barred zones, and is attempting to negotiate by offering greater facilities in the issue of safe-conducts, and other evasive measures, The recent announcement of the Allies as to dealing with vessels holding these safe-conducts will undoubtedly embarrass Germany in this matter, and it is believed that the Spanisl Government will maintain a firm attitude in its decision to seize interned enemy tonnage to replace future losses.Meanwhile two Spanish vessels have been torpedoed in the barred zones, viz. the s.s. " Carasa," on 25th August, with a loss of six lives, and the " Atxeri-Mendi," on 29tl August, but the Spanish Government has postponed decisive action until complete report! on these losses are obtained.Naval Staff,5th September, 1918.[Appendices!
